36638cfd141fcde2.title: EDI Analyst
36638cfd141fcde2.desc:
The Challenge 
  The successful candidate will be an experienced specialist on IBM's Sterling Integrator and File Gateway platform and will work closely with the business user community and IT colleagues to plan and execute new projects, system enhancements, and provide ongoing application support. As part of the Data Engineering team, this individual will craft innovative managed file transfer (MFT) solutions and procedures for various internal groups, including IT/IS, Sales, Finance, and Operations. You will be part of a team that maintains and optimizes the platform and participates in the strategic and tactical solutioning for our business clients. 
 
 
  Who We Are:  
 Headquartered in New York City, Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. is a leading developer, publisher, and marketer of interactive entertainment for consumers around the globe. The Company develops and publishes products principally through Rockstar Games, 2K, Private Division, and Zynga. Our products are currently designed for console gaming systems, PC, and Mobile, including smartphones and tablets, and are delivered through physical retail, digital download, online platforms, and cloud streaming services. The Company's common stock is publicly traded on NASDAQ under the symbol TTWO. 
  While our offices (physical and virtual) are casual and inviting, we are deeply committed to our core tenets of creativity, innovation and efficiency, and individual and team development opportunities. Our industry and business are continually evolving and fast-paced, providing numerous opportunities to learn and hone your skills. We work hard, but we also like to have fun, and believe that we provide a great place to come to work each day to pursue your passions. 
 
 
  What You'll Take On 
 
 Setup and maintain SFG and B2BI, partnerships, envelopes, AS2/SFTP communications, and routings 
 Build, modify, research areas of mapping, translation, and business processes 
 Research requests on data / file status via applications UIs, log files and flat file archives 
 Manage tickets in Company's ticketing system 
 Support data flows and connections between Take-Two and all endpoints 
 Restore/redeliver data, execute and support business processes 
 Perform application health checks 
 Maintain stability of IBM's Sterling Integrator and File Gateway platform and actively manage performance including capacity planning, tuning ,  and updates 
 Participate in remediation of EDI Sterling B2B incidents and events. Provide afterhours support for troubleshooting and issue resolution 
 
 
 
  What You Bring 
 
 3+ years of hands-on experience in IBM's  Sterling B2B  Integrator business processes, configurations, properties files and components 
 3+ years of hands on experience in MFT and IBM Sterling File Gateway partner setups, routings and communications 
 Demonstrable experience of ANSI X12 and EDIFACT EDI data structure 
 Demonstrable experience of AS2, SFTP and VAN communications 
 Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing 
 Good analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills to evaluate business problems and apply technology knowledge to identify appropriate solutions 
 Ability to work independently as well as part of a team 
 
 
 
  Great to Have: 
 
 Knowledge of Lightwell's Framework a plus 
 
 
 
  What We Offer You:  
 
 Great Company Culture . Ranked as one of the most creative and innovative places to work, creativity, innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success. 
 Growth : As a global entertainment company, we pride ourselves on creating environments where employees are encouraged to be themselves, inquisitive, collaborative and to grow within and around the company. 
 Work Hard, Play Hard.  Our employees bond, blow-off steam, and flex some creative muscles – through corporate boot camp classes, company parties, game release events, monthly socials, and team challenges. 
 Benefits . Medical (HSA & FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase plan, commuter benefits, in-house wellness program, broad learning & development opportunities, a charitable giving platform with company match and more! 
 Perks . Fitness allowance, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries and the ability to earn up to $500+ per year for taking care of yourself and more! 
 
 
 
  This position is open to remote candidates in the following states only: FL, MA, NJ, OH, TN, & TX 
  The pay range for this position in New York City at the start of employment is expected to be between $80,000 and $115,000 per Year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, company or individual department/team performance, and market factors

8207004792c0cd6e.title: Data Analyst Sales and Marketing (Remote)
8207004792c0cd6e.desc:
Midwest Veterinary Supply  is seeking a  Data Analyst of Sales and Marketing   for our corporate office in  Lakeville,  Minnesota . 
 
 
 
 
  Job Summary : 
  The Data Analyst, Sales and Marketing is a crucial member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team that will work collaboratively across the department and partner with Sales and Marketing leadership performing necessary data analyses and queries to solve business problems. The Data Analyst, Sales and Marketing is responsible for the design, development, and analysis of complex queries, reports, and data extracts from multiple data sources to enable the company to make smart, data-driven, and fiscally sound business decisions. The Data Analyst, Sales and Marketing will provide company-wide expertise on reporting best practices including data modeling, report design, and environment management. 
  Essential Job Functions : 
 
  Build custom data extractions, data summarizations, data prep processes for ongoing initiatives and rapidly changing business questions within the BI department set forth by Sales and Marketing leadership and their teams utilizing SQL against multiple databases. This includes the data extractions and summarizations required for validation of reports, metadata models, and database tables as they relate to the sales and marketing initiative or business question at hand. Provide insights, analyses, anomalies, testing results, key insights, and deliver actionable recommendations. Be the leading resources of knowledge for sales and marketing data including its structure, the processes that create the data sets, and its impact to the company. 
  Develop and maintain custom reports and custom SQL queries utilizing the company’s BI visualization and reporting tools. This includes the process to gather the data and validate the data against source systems and external sources of data. Deploy BI and data solutions in production environments with an emphasis on SQL, data transformation and visualizations, for consumption by sales and marketing end users. 
  Coordinate with the BI team to evaluate, challenge, and critique existing solutions and their impact on the company. Provide insights on project feasibility based on requirements gathered from leadership and SMEs (subject matter experts). 
  Maintain custom developed SQL programs and reports to ensure ongoing viability and usability 
  Provide support, clarification, and field questions pertaining to custom developed reports. Be a knowledge base for the Business Intelligence team as it relates to complex queries and the data utilized. 
  Maintain documentation, run schedules, and inventory of SQL programs and reports developed and deployed. 
  Perform other duties as assigned. 
 
  Organizational Competencies: 
  Must be able to perform job responsibilities in a professional manner, consistent with the needs of our internal and external customers and in accordance with all policies, procedures, and manuals. Maintain a good work ethic while taking intentional steps toward the fiscal health of Midwest Veterinary Supply. 
  Job Requirements & Qualifications : 
 
  Must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily 
  High School diploma/GED required. 
  More than 2 years, full time, writing SQL utilizing common data extraction and manipulation tools 
  and techniques in a professional environment is desired. 
  Experience with relational databases such as IBM DB2, Oracle, MS SQL Server, Postgres, or similar 
  is preferred. 
  Experience with IBM Cognos Analytics or IBM Planning Analytics/TM1 is preferred. 
  Experience with IBM iSeries/AS400/Power Systems is preferred. 
  Ability to read, write and speak English 
  Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, employment policies, operating 
  instructions, and procedural manuals. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  Curious mind that seeks out best practices and continuous improvement 
  Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL (selects, joins, unions, common table expressions, 
  updates, deletes, data formatting) 
  Familiarity with SQL editor tools such as Toad, SSMS, DBeaver, SQL Developer, or similar. 
  Demonstrated understanding of data warehousing concepts 
  Ability to convert business requirements into functional requirements 
  Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and multitask 
  Must be self-motivated, able to work independently, and problem solve 
  Excellent attention to detail 
  Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills 
  Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel is preferred 
  Working knowledge of Business Intelligence tools is preferred (IBM Cognos, Tableau, Business 
  Objects, Microsoft Power BI, or similar) 
  Basic computer skills, ability to operate a Windows-based computer and data entry 
  Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common 
  fractions, and decimals 
  Must be able to learn quickly to gain an intermediate to advanced understanding of Sales and 
  Marketing data sets, processes, and business models that directly impact the data 
  Strong problem-solving abilities 
  Life-long learner 
 
  Mental & Physical Demands : 
 
  Attention to detail critical to ensure accuracy and completion of objectives. 
  Regular interaction with people, team-player. 
  Fast pace of work requires multi-tasking. 
  Vision: close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. 
  Frequent use of a telephone – listening and speaking. 
  Ability to work at a desk throughout the day. 
  Frequent use of hands for writing and computer keyboard. 
 
  Equipment Used : 
  Regularly uses typical office equipment including computer keyboard and terminal, telephone, printer, fax and copier. 
  Work Environment: 
  Work will typically be performed Monday through Friday in an office environment. Working more than 40 hours per workweek may be required. (This is a remote position) 
  About Us :  Midwest Veterinary Supply, Inc. (MVS) has provided quality service and merchandise to the veterinary profession since 1961. Our products are distributed from eight branches located in key geographic locations within our trade area. We take great pride in getting our orders out the same day as called in and having the product in the customer's hand the next day. MVS carries products and equipment from most major manufacturers. As we continue to grow, our goal will be, as it has always been, to provide the veterinary profession the very best in service along with quality merchandise at fair and competitive prices.    Midwest Veterinary Supply believes in providing equal employment opportunities for all employees and will not violate any law prohibiting discrimination for or against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of any characteristic protected under local, state, or federal statute, ordinance, or regulation. To view applicable employment notices, please click here to visit our Careers page. California residents, click here to view the California Consumer Privacy Act Disclosure. 
  Job duties and requirements may be subject to modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Requirements are representative of the minimum levels of education, experience and skills required to perform the essential functions of this job. The job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Midwest Veterinary Supply reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.    MVS1961

fd5002d9adeb0349.title: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
fd5002d9adeb0349.desc:
Posted 
      
 
      25-Oct-2023 
      
 
 
 
      Service line 
      
 
      GWS Segment 
      
 
 
 
      Role type 
      
 
      Full-time 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Areas of Interest 
      
 
      Digital & Technology/Information Technology 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Location(s) 
      
 
      Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Our Digital & Technology organization sits at the heart of CBRE. As part of our team, you’ll be able to learn from the most brilliant engineers, designers, and product managers while solving tough problems that will drive our technology forward.   
 
 About The Role  
 The purpose of this position is to provide complex research, data mining/analysis, reporting, and interpretation of global, national, regional, local, and/or account company performance metrics.   
 
 What You’ll Do  
 
 Design, generate, review, and understand reports. Use aggregate data from various sources to build a complete analysis, improvement, and/or recommendation(s). 
  Prepare and present results of analysis and reports along with their relative impact(s) to the business to all levels of management. 
  Act as project lead, including supervisory and/or managerial activities, in the coordination of the analyst team to successfully complete specified projects. 
  Develop scenario planning tools/models (exit/maintain/grow). Prepare forecasts and analyzes trends in general business conditions. 
  Find opportunities for improvements by and among the clients and/or companies. 
  Review accuracy of information provided and respond to requests from management and vendors. 
  Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key systems/processes in subject teams and day-to-day functions.  Coordinates the involvement of personnel from other teams and information technology groups to facilitate successful project implementations. 
       
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 What You’ll Need 
 
  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS or equivalent experience) from a 4-year college or university required. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 5 years of related experience and/or training.  
 Advanced experience in MS Office Products (Excel, SmartSheet, Power BI, Tableau, Access, PowerPoint, Word, etc).  
 PMP certification and/or Lean 6-sigma green belt preferred. 
  Excellent data management, manipulation, and analysis skills. Ability to create integrated data models from disparate sources. Understanding of relational databases. Highly skilled in dashboard design and development. Advanced Tableau skills are required. Proficiency in database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server is preferred. 
  Ability to use query and report generation tools. Self-service/web-based application experience desired.  
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal and analytical skills. Ability to deliver efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.  Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills. 
       
 
 Why CBRE?  
 CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, and we have been ranked #1 on Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Company: (2019, 2020, 2021,2023). With services, insights, and data that span every dimension of the industry, we build digital solutions for clients of every size, in every sector, and across every geography. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 CBRE carefully considers multiple factors to determine compensation, including a candidate’s education, training, and experience. The minimum salary for the position is  $85,000  annually and the maximum salary for the position is  $95,000  annually. The compensation that is offered to a successful candidate will depend on the candidate’s skills, qualifications, and experience. Successful candidates will also be eligible for a discretionary bonus based on CBRE’s applicable benefit program. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. If you have a disability that inhibits your ability to apply for a position through our online application process, you may contact us via email at recruitingaccommodations@cbre.com or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada). 
      
 
 
 
 NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.

About Us: 
  SentinelOne is defining the future of cybersecurity through our XDR platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Singularity XDR ingests data and leverages our patented AI models to deliver autonomous protection. With SentinelOne, organizations gain full transparency into everything happening across the network at machine speed – to defeat every attack, at every stage of the threat lifecycle. 
  We are a values-driven team where names are known, results are rewarded, and friendships are formed. Trust, accountability, relentlessness, ingenuity, and OneSentinel define the pillars of our collaborative and unified global culture. We're looking for people that will drive team success and collaboration across SentinelOne. If you're enthusiastic about innovative approaches to problem-solving, we would love to speak with you about joining our team! 
 
  What are we looking for? 
  SentinelOne is seeking a Senior Sales Operations Analyst to support the Renewals and Customer Success team and all related tasks as we expand and be part of a transforming business. This role will manage the day to day support and projects that impact our processes, systems and data. 
  What will you do? 
 
 Performs regular maintenance on Sales, Renewals, and Customer Success data in Salesforce 
 Play an integral role in creating reporting and analysis for day-to-day, quarterly, and yearly business operations 
 Work with cross functional departments for common operations best practices around process, system and data to scale 
 Evaluates ways to automate and improve current processes, tools and dashboards to drive operational and productivity improvements within both organizations 
 Analyze data and leverage insights to identify problems, effectively incorporates improvements and track success 
 Assist with GTM operations special ad hoc projects and analysis by working with other stakeholder departments for overall alignment 
 Establish and formally document best practices and standards for Sales, Renewals, and Customer Success productivity 
 Provide support and evaluate upcoming projects in other areas in order to support the growing business 
 
 What skills and knowledge should you bring? 
 
 Bachelor degree preferred 
 2-4 years of work experience at an enterprise software company 
 
 2 years in a business ops, data analyst, or consulting role 
 
 Excellent communicator both in-person and virtually 
 Experience using spreadsheets (Excel and Google Sheets) for data manipulation 
 Experience with Tableau & Reporting 
 Experience with project management 
 Comfortable working with Excel pivot tables, vlookups and fuzzy lookups 
 Working knowledge of Salesforce 
 Strong creative problem solving abilities 
 Results driven, self motivated and ability to multitask 
 Organized, with excellent attention to detail and work in a fast paced environment 
 
 Why us? 
  You will be joining a cutting-edge company where you will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very best in the industry. 
 
 Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Commuter, Health and Dependent FSA 
 Unlimited PTO 
 Industry-leading gender-neutral parental leave 
 Paid Company Holidays 
 Paid Sick Time 
 Employee stock purchase program 
 Disability and life insurance 
 Employee assistance program 
 Gym membership reimbursement 
 Cell phone reimbursement 
 Numerous company-sponsored events, including regular happy hours and team-building events 
 
 
 
 
  This U.S. role has a base pay range that will vary based on the location of the candidate. For some 
    
  locations, a different pay range may apply. If so, this range will be provided to you during the recruiting 
    
  process. You can also reach out to the recruiter with any questions.
    
 
  Base Salary Range 
 
    $94,000—$129,000 USD
   
 
 
  SentinelOne is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

fbdd7ea125290eb3.title: Business Analyst
fbdd7ea125290eb3.desc:
Company Background 
 Founded in 1992, Mi-Case is the industry leader in fully integrated offender management software solutions and provides industry expertise and consulting within Criminal Justice and Public Safety systems. 
 Mi-Case leverages a unique combination of technical, functional and industry specialization as well as partnerships with key software vendors to deliver maximum value add projects. 
 Position Summary 
 A Business Analyst at Mi-Case is responsible for completing analytical functions in the organization. The position requires you to collaborate with clients and be responsible for eliciting, documenting, and analyzing business requirements to ensure the successful completion of projects. Business Analysts will work within software development teams to complete organization goals and objectives. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Analysis and Documentation : Document complex business processes, requirements, wireframes, and specifications. Uncover opportunities for Improvement. 
 Change Management:  Assist in change management efforts by communicating changes, impacts, and benefits to stakeholders. 
 Collaboration : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather information, share insights, and contribute to projects 
 Data Analysis : Assist in collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to extract meaningful insights and trends. 
 Demonstrate Functionality : Assist in demoing application functionality to clients and future clients. 
 Problem-Solving :Participate in problem-solving activities and contribute ideas to address business challenges. 
 Project Coordination : Collaborate with project managers to ensure the successful delivery of projects, including scope, timeline, and budget management. 
 Reporting : Prepare and maintain reports for project tracking and communicate findings and project progress effectively. 
 Requirements Gathering:  Lead requirements gathering efforts, collaborating with stakeholders to identify business needs and objectives. 
 Research : Conduct research on industry trends, market conditions, and competitors to support decision-making processes. 
 Solution Design : Contribute to the design of efficient and effective solutions that address business challenges and align with organizational strategies. 
 Stakeholder Engagement : Maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, serving as a liaison between business units and IT teams. 
 Support:  Provide support to senior analysts and team members in various phases of analysis. 
 
 Educational /Training and Certification Requirements 
 
 Bachelor's degree in business, finance, information technology, or related field. 
 3+ years of experience in business analysis or a related role, demonstrating progressively increasing responsibilities. 
 Proficiency in business analysis methodologies, tools, and documentation techniques. 
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex business problems into clear and actionable requirements. 
 Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the capacity to interact effectively with stakeholders at various levels of the organization. 
 Experience utilizing software development design tools and processes such as Azure DevOps. 
 Project management knowledge and experience are advantageous. 
 Certification in business analysis preferred but not required. 
 
 Knowledge, Skills, and Experience 
 
 Ability to learn new domains and become an expert in the field. 
 Strong computer and internet skills including all MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint). 
 Must be efficient with strong attention to detail. 
 Skills in organization and planning, demonstrated ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment and problem solving. 
 Strong knowledge on agile software development methodology 
 Must be able to work across multiple projects, where necessary 
 Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills 
 Ability to control scope and manage stakeholder expectations. 
 Strong skills in organization and planning, demonstrated ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment and problem solving. 
 Proven ability to manage projects. 
 
 Environmental and/or Physical Factors 
 
 Typical 40+ hour workweek. Longer hours may be necessary at times. 
 Required to stand, walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. 
 Constant adequate range of motion and mobility required. 
 
 If you are a detail-oriented individual with excellent analytical skills and a passion for data analysis, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience. 
 Job Types: Full-time, Permanent 
 Pay: $65,557.30 - $86,998.00 per year 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 3% Match 
 401(k) matching 
 Dental insurance 
 Flexible spending account 
 Health insurance 
 Health savings account 
 Life insurance 
 Paid holidays 
 Paid time off 
 Professional development assistance 
 Vision insurance 
 Work from home 
 
 Compensation package: 
 
 Bonus opportunities 
 Performance bonus 
 Yearly pay 
 
 Experience level: 
 
 3 years 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 Monday to Friday 
 
 Education: 
 
 Bachelor's (Required) 
 
 Experience: 
 
 Business analysis: 3 years (Required) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

ec7294e2e9e034fd.title: Remote Project Management Analyst (Project Management Analyst 3) - 16665
ec7294e2e9e034fd.desc:
Requisition Number: 16665 
  
  Required Travel: 0 - 10% 
  
  Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt
  
  Anticipated Salary Range: $66,913.00 - $100,000.00 
  
  Security Clearance: Ability to Obtain 
  
  Level of Experience: Mid
  
 
 Meet HII's Mission Technologies Division 
  Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense - the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.
  
 
 Who We Are  
 
  Are you a strategic thinker who enjoys working on complex issues and looking to use your skills and talents to support dynamic customers with challenging missions? Then we would like to discuss working on tomorrow's challenges today.
  
  The Project Management Analyst will focus on supporting the logistics and procurement functions for projects across the globe. You will oversee and manage the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serve as a liaison between project management and planning, project team, logistics, and procurement. You will be responsible for the flow of goods, services, and information between points of origin through receipt at the destination; advising on and assisting with procuring goods and services; and optimizing for efficient operations from requirement generation through delivery across multiple projects.
  
  Duties include compiling and analyzing data regarding the sourcing and purchase of supplies, tools, equipment, parts, and end items necessary to fulfill customer requirements; developing and reviewing requisitions for and managing records of supplies and services; and reviewing configuration changes to evaluate impact on logistics deployment.
  
 
 What You Will Do 
 
 
 Continually assess and optimize logistics and procurement operations to reduce lead times, improve inventory and requisition management, and enhance overall efficiency. 
 Collaborate in cross functional teams, including logistics, procurement, finance, and program management to ensure proper and timely execution of requirements. 
 Assess project issues and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client satisfaction goals and objectives. 
 Develop mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with project managers, line managers, and clients. 
 Advise and execute shipment of goods internationally using all modes of transportation to include air, ground, and sea. 
 Compile and analyze data regarding the sourcing and purchase of supplies. 
 Review, track, and report on the status of material requisitions to ensure timely movement of items. 
 Builds relationships with manufacturing, suppliers, and customers through the resolution of delivery issues. 
 
 
 
 What We Are Looking For 
 
 
 6 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 4 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 10 years relevant experience. 
 Must be a US Citizen.  
 Experience in planning, controlling, and executing work in a high volume/paced environment.  
 Strong Microsoft Office skills are required.  
 Functional knowledge and experience with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.  
 Extensive writing and oral communication skills.  
 Ability to interface at all-levels of command and leadership on a regular basis.  
 Must be customer-service oriented and work well in a team environment. 
 Must be detail-oriented and able to prioritize tasks and projects. 
 Must possess strong organizational skills and be able to handle multiple priorities and projects at one time. 
 Effective interpersonal skills to coordinate efforts and work with other internal and external organizations. 
 Strong written and oral communication skills. 
 Demonstrated flexibility and ability to adapt to changing organizational needs. 
 
 
 
 Preferred: Bonus Points For... 
 
 
 Experience in Smartsheet, Teams, and collaborating in a remote environment. 
 Familiar with Government procurement and logistics operations. 
 
 
 
 Why HII 
  We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.
  
  Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.
  
 
 Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive. 
  Today's challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It's why we're focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees.
  
  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
  
 
 Do You Need Assistance?  
  If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to 
  buildyourcareer@hii-co.com  and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 
  1-844-849-8463  for assistance. Press #3 for HII Technical Solutions.

a44ff821d5795b0f.title: Epic Business Intelligence Reporting and Analytics Developer/Analyst
a44ff821d5795b0f.desc:
Job Title- Epic Business Intelligence Reporting and Analytics Developer/Analyst 
 Location- 100% remote 
 Duration- 9 months 
 Certifications: 
 
 Required: Epic Clarity, Caboodle Financial or Clinical Data Model (or legacy equivalents) 
 
 This consultant will primarily convert existing Finance SAP Crystal reports into stored procedures and SSIS packages. The ideal candidate would have a working knowledge of SSIS development, SQL experience writing stored procedures (Microsoft), and be able to extract SQL logic from existing SAP Crystal reports. Knowledge of Epic Professional and Hospital Billing are required. 
 The role requires consultant communication skills – in particular, independently participating in project meetings and project decisions to ensure that deliverables support Analytics & project goals and deadlines. It further requires the ability to coalesce related requests and offer solutions that satisfy multiple requirements, and Software Development Life Cycle discipline: gathering & documenting and confirming requirements, designing solutions, obtaining SME signoff, coding, testing/validation, UAT, & documentation. 
 This role also requires collaborative cross-functional team skills – in particular, working on collaborative solutions with operational clinical leaders, application build analysts, Epic boost and TS resources, as well as other analytics business intelligence developers and peer testers. 
 Typical Tasks: Extract SQL query / logic from existing finance SAP Crystal reports.· Evaluate/consolidate multiple instances of similar reports into a single output.· Create stored procedures on SQL server.· Create SSIS packages to call stored procedures while passing parameters.· Optimize any existing SQL queries (knowledge of Clarity HB and PB required).· Produce comprehensive documentation of developed processes and workflows.· 
 Required Skills & Abilities: Minimum 3 years of experience with Epic reporting in a hospital / health system setting.· 5+ years of SQL query and stored procedure development experience.· Working knowledge of Epic Clarity HB· & PB reporting. 3+ years of SSIS development experience.· 2+ years of SAP Crystal report development.· Must be a self-starter comfortable working under general direction.· 
 Desired Qualifications: Any Epic certifications / experience reporting against Epic data.· Professional (PB) and Hospital Billing (HB) reporting experience.· Government, public or non-profit sector experience.· 
 Job Type: Contract 
 Pay: $40.00 - $60.00 per hour 
 Experience: 
 
 SQL: 1 year (Preferred) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

  Business Analyst

 If so, you might be our next new team member! 
  Who we need: 
  Acentra Health is currently looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team! 
  As a Business Analyst, you will provide functional and technical support and coordination in healthcare applications, perform requirements gathering and analysis, propose business solutions, and provide operations support.

Our benefits include comprehensive health plans, paid time off, retirement savings, corporate wellness, educational assistance, corporate discounts, and more. 
  What you’ll do: 
 
 Provide business and technical analysis in healthcare system applications including bill processing, reference, and rates and reports 
 Identify areas for process improvement to improve quality and optimize costs 
 Frequently apply in-depth Business Analysis knowledge to review and analyze systems problems and identify solutions 
 Analyze client business and user requirements, while leveraging expert opinion and expertise

 Provide support for systems operations activities 
 Collaborate with the technical team to propose functional and technical solutions for complex business requirements 
 Work closely with cross-functional principals, specialists, and technical management to improve business analysis quality across the enterprise 
 Conduct complex and vital work critical to the organization and work with complete latitude for independent judgment 
 Conduct requirements gathering 
 Present solutions and write functional and technical specifications for business requirements 
 Develop stakeholder relationships and process efficiencies in systems operations 
 Communicate expert knowledge to customers and industry experts 
 Research and evaluate industry trends and technologies for solving complex technical problems 
 
 Job Qualifications 
  What you’ll need: 
  Required Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor's degree 
 
  Knowledge, Skills, Abilities 
 
 Excellent customer relation skills including presentation and meeting facilitation 
 Excellent requirements elicitation and validation skills 
 Strong knowledge of Healthcare applications 
 Knowledge of data integration and software enhancements/planning 
 Excellent understanding of technical systems knowledge 
 Knowledge of Government healthcare programs is highly preferred 
 
 Experience

 Experience as a primary business analysis contributor on large complex projects

 Business Analysis Process (SDLC, documentation procedures) experience

 Thank You! 
  We know your time is valuable and we thank you for applying for this position. Due to the high volume of applicants, only those who are chosen to advance in our interview process will be contacted. We sincerely appreciate your interest in  Acentra Health  and invite you to apply to future openings that may be of interest. Best of luck in your search!

7c9251cbff8ff525.title: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Business Analyst (PPM)
7c9251cbff8ff525.desc:
Nemours is seeking an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Business Analyst (Full-Time), to join our Nemours Children's Health team. This position will support the Project Portfolio Management modules. 
 
 
 This is a Remote position. 
 
  We are looking for an analyst experienced in Oracle's Project Portfolio Management (PPM) suite of modules. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Oracle's Cloud or e-Business suite and associated technologies. This position will be required to conduct workflow analysis, provide recommendations for system design and/or corrective actions, perform testing of software updates, and ensure timely resolution of problems within the application via normal change control processes. While this position is specific for PPM, the analyst will be involved across all specialties (Financial Management, Human Resources and Talent Management and Supply Chain) at various times throughout the product life cycle.
  
 
 Essential Functions 
 
 
 Serve as a functional leader in configuration and/or maintenance of various Oracle modules, but with primary emphasis/expertise on one. 
 Understand data structures and table relationships to build, maintain and/or troubleshoot queries, reports or integrations. 
 Work collaboratively with team to design highly-complex business processes in systems configuration activities including build, testing, validation, and documentation of system changes.  
 Work with the technical team to translate the business requirements to technical requirements and coordinate with the technical teams to obtain the desired functionality, including reporting and system interfaces. 
 Assist in identification of opportunities for implementation of new features or features not currently in use, make recommendations and work with end-users to implement features or changes to improve efficiencies. 
 Assist in writing test-plans/scripts and assist with testing of configurations as well as training of end-users. 
 Create/maintain Oracle system/application documentation (requirements, processes and procedures). 
 Provide end user support and troubleshooting for issues related to ERP system, including writing and running reports to query data from Oracle and analyze as needed. 
 Participate in periodic Oracle change control meetings. 
 Provide Oracle product support to all functional business areas.  Serve as an Oracle subject matter expert (SME) for learning how the ERP works-with primary emphasis on one
   -including staying abreast of newly-released features, maintenance updates and patches. 
 
 
 Performance Skills 
 
 
 Must possess experience enhancing/implementing/configuring/fixing, both technically and functionally, large organizational systems. 
 Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills and demonstrate experience articulating issues/concerns/solutions. 
 Must be able to lead functional discussions to analyze build requirements and brainstorm solutions. 
 Demonstrate a clear understanding of the cross-functional impact of all Oracle modules, with emphasis on the one assigned. 
 Able to work independently, schedule time efficiently and set priorities in a fast-paced environment. 
 Build and foster professional relationships. Expected to work alongside associates from other departments when executing daily responsibilities and as a contributor to cross-functional projects. 
 
 
 Job Requirements 
 
 
 Preferred 4-year degree or a 2-year degree with equivalent experience required. 
 Minimum of five (5) + years experience required. 
 System implementation experience required. 
 Oracle Cloud or Oracle EBS experience required. 
 1+ years of SQL experience preferred. 
 Strong business operations experience with emphasis on the selected/assigned module. 
 Must possess experience enhancing/implementing/configuring/fixing, both technically and functionally, large organizational systems. 
 Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills and demonstrate experience articulating issues/concerns/solutions. 
 Must be able to lead functional discussions to analyze build requirements and brainstorm solutions. 
 Demonstrate a clear understanding of the cross-functional impact of all Oracle modules, with emphasis on the one assigned. 
 Able to work independently, schedule time efficiently and set priorities in a fast-paced environment. 
 Must be an effective communicator and able to multi task and prioritize problems/issues/requests/enhancements.

c4076c6548dd0550.desc:
Business Analyst II Remote, Work from Home US Authorized* W2 *Candidate seeking 1099 or are corp-to-corp will not be considered.
  
  Position Summary: Primary candidates will have worked with enrollment and eligibility platforms in an analytical capacity (i.e. must be an intermediate to advanced user of PLSQL). Secondary candidates will have Medicare / Medicaid / Exchange Enrollment experience in an analytical role or IT role within the software configuration / development space. Tertiary candidates will have analytical experience within either a business or IT related role. Prior experience with the implementation of a Medicare / Medicaid / Exchange Enrollment application would be a strong plus! Keywords: Market Prominence, Medicare Enrollment, Medicaid Enrollment, Exchange Enrollment, Software Development, Software Configuration, SQL
  
  This is a Scrum Team role that will be a member of the Medicare / Medicaid / Exchange Enrollment Configuration team tasked with developing purpose built capabilities for our NextGen platform. This role is responsible for delivering analysis, requirements of oversight for various stories within an Agile framework.
  
  Duties:
  
 
 Performs analysis and translates business needs to create high-quality Business Requirements and Functional Specifications documentation within specified time frames to solve moderately complex problems (multiple interfaces with other systems within a business unit) considering all impacted components from an end-to-end perspective. 
 Performs data analytics using SQL / PLSQL at an intermediate level 
 Ensures end-to-end traceability of requirements is complete. 
 Applies specific functional and/or business expertise to perform assigned tasks and develop specific project deliverables. 
 Conducts impact analysis of configuration changes on business processes and existing technology. 
 Competent to work with minimal supervision in a technical capacity on most phases of the business systems analysis. 
 Contributes to the review of Test Planning and Test Execution strategies. 
 Develops business workflow diagrams. 
 Assists in the development of data models and interface design specifications. 
 Documents, tracks, and resolves issues related to data quality. 
 Contributes to the design and mapping of data conversion strategies. 
 Participates in collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources, and development resources. 
 Completes project activities on time and within budget, and proactively identifies and communicates issues that may jeopardize milestones or project budget to the Project Manager / Product Owner. 
 Adheres to SDLC or AGILE project management methodology by utilizing internal procedures and tools and identifying areas for methodology improvement. 
 Develops Product Overviews, FAQs, Tool Glossaries, system training material, and system user documentation to support implementation activities. 
 Creates appropriate communication materials are documented and distributed appropriately. 
 Conducts interviews, fact-finding, and independent research to design creative, progressive solutions for business problems. 
 Supports the Product Owner with other Scrum Team tasks (hosts / facilitates meetings, taking detailed notes, completes analysis / research) as needed 
 
  Minimum Qualifications
  
 
 Experience with PLSQL, SQL Server and / or Oracle, SQL Server databases (2-4 years) 
 Experience with software development lifecycles, having owned: detailed analysis (data / process analytics, process improvements, process flow creation, requirements gathering, requirements traceability through the software delivery lifecycle, including post-production checkout / reviews. (4-6 years) 
 Experience with extensive analytical techniques (Scenarios and Use-cases, Scope Modeling, Functional Decomposition, Interviews, Observation / Job Shadowing, Focus Groups, Acceptance and Evaluation, Sequence Diagrams, User Stories, Brainstorming, Storyboarding, Prototyping, Event Analysis, Business Rule Analysis, Requirements Workshops, Risk Analysis, Root Cause Analysis) (4-6 years) 
 
  Preferred
  
 
 Experience with software development lifecycles, having contributed to: estimation (resource planning), capacity planning, requirement gathering, testing framework and strategy, and post implementation review. (4-6 years) 
 Experience with member materials / correspondence implementation experience (2-4 years) 
 Experience with Medicare, Medicaid or Exchange Enrollment, Billing and Correspondence Operations (2-4 years) 
 Leadership / Creating Accountability (Intermediate) 
 Leadership / Developing and Executing Strategy (Intermediate) 
 Leadership / Driving a Culture of Compliance (Foundational) 
 General Business Consulting for Solutions (Advanced) 
 Leadership / Anticipating and Innovating (Advanced) 
 Technology / Justifying the Business Case (Advanced) 
 Experience with enterprise-wide and / or cross-functional large scale initiatives with high degree of complexity. 
 Demonstrated experience successfully implementing change in complex organizations 
 Demonstrated relationship management skills at the senior level; capacity to quickly build and maintain credible relationships at varying levels of the organization simultaneously. 
 
  Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
  
  About NTT Data Services:
  
  NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services, including cloud, data and applications, headquartered in Texas. As part of NTT DATA, a $30 billion trusted global innovator with a combined global reach of over 80 countries, we help clients transform through business and technology consulting, industry and digital solutions, applications development and management, managed edge-to-cloud infrastructure services, BPO, systems integration and global data centers. We are committed to our clients' long-term success. Visit nttdata.com or LinkedIn to learn more.
  
  NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. 19402439b2db8e36.title: Risk Analyst
19402439b2db8e36.desc:
Job Title:  Risk Analyst 
  Reporting to:  Operational Risk Officer 
 
  What does a Risk Analyst do? 
  Supports the Risk organization as a trusted advisor/consultant to the line of business consulting on the major risk factors influencing their financial success. Risk Analysts help determine if business ideas are viable based on the amount of risk the company shareholders want to take on. They collect data to determine risk vs. reward and translate them into key risk indicators(KRIs) that are leading indicators of risk. Risk Analysts also support root cause identification and make recommendations on how to mitigate risk to an acceptable level commiserate with the risk appetite of the organization. They routinely monitor KRIs and help adjust the risk posture and appetite as business strategy and objectives evolve. 
 
  About Us: 
  BM Technologies, Inc. (NYSE American: BMTX, BMTX.W) is among the largest digital banking platforms in the U.S., providing access to checking and savings accounts, personal loans, credit cards, and financial wellness. It is focused on technology, innovation, easy-to-use products, and education with the mission of being “customer-obsessed” and creating “customers for life.” The BMTX digital banking platform employs a multi-partner distribution model, known as “Banking-as-a-Service” (BaaS), that enables the acquisition of customers at higher volumes and substantially lower expenses than traditional banks while providing significant benefits to its customers, partners, and business. BMTX currently serves over two million account holders and provides disbursement services at approximately 725 college and university campuses (covering one out of every three students in the U.S.). BM Technologies, Inc. is a technology company and is not a bank, which means it provides banking services through its Member FDIC and Equal Housing Lender partner banks. 
 
  Requirements: The value you bring! 
  Skills: 
 
 Analytical: Strong analytical skills are a must for a Risk Analyst. They must be able to quickly analyze a large collection of data, then create reports and determine results. 
 Decision making: Risk Analysts are often in charge of making business and financial decisions for their clients. The ability to quickly analyze data and make a decision, such as which stock or whether or not to issue credit, is crucial. 
 Communication: Written and verbal communication skills are important for Risk Analysts. They must communicate clearly and effectively with clients and team members at all levels 
 Process Mapping 
 
  Develop executive-level presentations to include summaries and recommendations Project management 
  Qualifications: 
 
 Ability to quickly understand business process 
 Make recommendations to reduce risk, e.g., propose control enhancements, develop KRI/threshold reporting, establish limits 
 Use critical thinking in combination with GRC tools and data to calculate the risk of a decision 
 
  Consult with business decision-makers and understand their business objectives, data and needs Evaluate business processes, objectives, financials to determine various levels of risk 
 
 Create reports and anticipate the losses of certain business decisions 
 
 
  What do you have to look forward to? 
  In this role, you'll be the go-to person for sizing risks and closely monitoring Key Risk Indicators. As part of our growing team, you'll be in charge of creating and keeping tabs on these KRIs. You'll also be the detective when it comes to spotting problems, figuring out why they happened, and coming up with smart fixes. This position will have a great impact on our operations at BMTX. If this prospect excites you, we would love to hear from you! 
 
  Education and Experience 
  A bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, or statistics or commensurate experience of 3+ years in a risk management-type role at a financial services organization

0332d703ad9b491a.title: Senior Legal Business Analyst (Board of Veteran Appeals)
0332d703ad9b491a.desc:
Position Description:  
 The Senior Legal Business Analyst plays a crucial role in the Board of Veteran Appeals (BVA) by bridging the gap between legal requirements and technological solutions. This position requires a deep understanding of legal processes, regulations, and the BVA's operations, along with expertise in business analysis. The Senior Legal Business Analyst collaborates with legal stakeholders, IT teams, and subject matter experts to analyze legal requirements, identify technology solutions, and ensure that systems align with the BVA's strategic goals. 
 
 
  Key Responsibilities: 
 
 Legal Requirements Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of legal processes, procedures, and regulations within the BVA. Collaborate with legal stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, concise, and unambiguous business and functional requirements. 
 Technology Solution Identification: Work closely with IT teams and subject matter experts to identify suitable technology solutions that meet the legal requirements of the BVA. Evaluate existing systems, propose enhancements, and recommend new technologies to support the legal operations effectively. 
 Business Process Analysis: Analyze and document existing legal processes within the BVA, identifying areas for improvement, streamlining, and automation. Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document optimized and efficient legal workflows. 
 Requirements Documentation: Create detailed requirement specifications, including use cases, process flows, data models, and other relevant artifacts. Ensure that legal requirements are clearly documented and communicated to both legal and technical stakeholders. 
 Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with legal stakeholders, IT teams, and subject matter experts to facilitate effective communication and ensure alignment between legal requirements and technology solutions. Serve as a point of contact for legal-related discussions and provide guidance on best practices. 
 Change Management: Manage changes to legal requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct impact analysis, communicate changes to stakeholders, and ensure proper documentation and traceability of requirements. 
 Quality Assurance: Participate in quality assurance activities, including reviewing test plans, test cases, and test results to ensure that developed solutions meet the specified legal requirements. Identify and address any gaps or inconsistencies in the requirements throughout the development lifecycle. 
 Subject Matter Expertise: Maintain a deep understanding of legal processes, regulations, and policies within the BVA. Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies related to legal operations and business analysis. 
 
 
 
  Qualifications: 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Legal Studies, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.  
 Proven experience as a Legal Business Analyst, Legal Operations Analyst, or similar role, preferably within the context of the Board of Veteran Appeals. 
 In-depth knowledge of legal processes, regulations, and policies related to the BVA's operations. 
 Strong understanding of business analysis techniques, methodologies, and tools. 
 Familiarity with software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies and their application to legal requirements analysis. 
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills. 
 Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with legal and technical stakeholders. 
 Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality deliverables. 
 Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. 
 Understanding of veterans' benefits and the appeals process is highly desirable. 
 
 
 
  Transitioning military and/or Veterans with relevant experience are invited to apply. Sprezzatura is an equal-opportunity employer. Sprezzatura offers benefits including healthcare, 401K, vacation, and paid sick leave. 
 
 
  Company Description 
  Sprezzatura Management Consulting, LLC (www.sprezzmc.com) is a Washington, DC-area Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) that enables government transformation by supplying insight and leadership at the intersection of people, processes, and technology. We apply knowledge, project, and life-cycle management best practices to catalyze change.

625679bd319a4b4c.title: Senior BI Business Systems Analyst - Remote Opportunity
625679bd319a4b4c.desc:
Futures start here. Where first steps, new friendships, and confident learners are born. At KinderCare Learning Companies, the first and only early childhood education provider recognized with the  Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award , we offer a variety of early education and child care options for families. We pave the way for their lifelong learning journey ahead. And we want you to join us in shaping a future we can all be proud to share—in neighborhoods, at work, and in schools nationwide. 
  At KinderCare Learning Companies, you’ll use your skills and expertise to support the work (and fun) that happens in our sites and centers every day. From marketers and strategists to financial analysts and data engineers, and so much more, we’re all passionate about crafting a world where children, families, and organizations can thrive. 
  We are building out a new Business Intelligence solution including an Enterprise Data Warehouse Microsoft Power BI for reporting and analytics. As Senior BI BSA (Business Systems Analyst) you'll build partnerships across the business to ensure delivery of optimum solution. 
  Responsibilities: 
 
 Define and document data, analytic, and reporting requirements using industry-standard analysis and documentation techniques including data interrogation and data profiling of source systems. 
 Elicit business requirements, document in-use cases, user stories, and acceptance criteria for agile delivery team. Build visualizations and traditional tabular reports using Microsoft PowerBI to support defined business needs. 
 PowerBI champion for business leaders around dashboards, analytics, and data visualizations development and drive process efficiency/improvements. 
 Develop data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse and standardize data that helps to generate insights and addresses analytic and reporting needs. Research and analysis of operational, HR, and financial data and trends. Translate conclusions into understandable and actionable information 
 Use data, modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance. Support ad-hoc projects in support of driving business insights, intelligence, and improvements. 
 Provide instructor led training and support to end users on navigation of the BI system. Provide input on architecture of Data Model and ETL processes based on business requirements and in-depth knowledge of data sources. 
 Assist in preparation and execution of test cases for initiatives including support of user acceptance testing 
 
 Qualifications:  
 
 Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience in Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics or other quantitative focus. Minimum 5 years in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, SQL & SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) & PowerBI. 
 Minimum 3 years as a Data Analyst or similar role for Business Intelligence projects. Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft BI and the ability to create report mockups, optimize Microsoft Power BI reports/dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization. 
 Understanding of data warehousing concepts and relational data models. Experience crafting reports, dashboards, and/or summarizing large amounts of data into actionable intelligence to drive business decisions. 
 Hands-on experience using SQL for performing data profiling, formatting and ad hoc data analysis and navigate a relational database. Scripting language (R, Python, DAX, etc.) is a plus. 
 AWS (Amazon Web Services) ecosystem, including services such as Amazon Redshift, Athena, and AWS Glue to create data models and extract valuable insights. 
 Advanced Excel data manipulation. Strong analytical skills, able to turn data analysis into business-impacting insights, acute attention to detail. 
 
 Our benefits meet you where you are.  We’re here to help our employees navigate the integration of work and life: 
 
 Know your whole family is supported with  discounted child care benefits. 
 Breathe easy with  medical, dental, and vision benefits  for your family (and pets, too!). 
 Feel supported in your mental health and personal growth with  employee assistance programs. 
 Feel great and thrive with access to  health and wellness programs, unlimited paid time off  and  discounts  for work necessities, such as cell phones. 
 … and much more. 
 
 We operate research-backed, accredited, and customizable programs in more than 2,000 sites and centers across 40 states and the District of Columbia. As we expand, we’re matching the needs of more and more families, dynamic work environments, and diverse communities from coast to coast. Because we believe every family deserves access to high-quality child care, no matter who they are or where they live. Every day, you’ll help bring this mission to life by building community and delivering exceptional experiences. And if you’re anything like us, you’ll come for the work, and stay for the people. 
  KinderCare Learning Companies is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law. 
  Primary Location : Portland, Oregon, United States 
  Job : Corporate

0d41378f284570c4.title: Media Analyst
0d41378f284570c4.desc:
About You: 
  You enjoy hands-on learning experiences and excel in dynamic work environments. You are passionate about digital technologies and various digital marketing platforms. You thrive in a culture that values flexibility, teamwork, data analysis, and innovative thinking.  
 The successful candidate will be a curious, analytical individual who wants to create a career in digital marketing. Our ideal candidate thrives with challenges and seeks to expand their knowledge. Level will provide extensive training, guidance and support, as well as the opportunity to experience the industry from the inside and gain valuable work experience.  
 Does this sound like you? If so, Level Agency is currently looking for an enthusiastic and motivated  Media Analyst  to join our team and we can’t wait to meet you!  
 About Us:  
 At Level, we use the scientific method to drive effective performance marketing campaigns for our clients. Everything from media planning to the ad creative is done with methodical care. Our cross-functional teams use a “Test. Learn. Grow.” framework that allows them to act with urgency and quickly adapt to the ever-changing world of performance marketing. This nimbleness and willingness to rethink what we know leads to better decision-making—and the confidence our clients need to pursue bold ambitions.  
 Recently ranked on the Inc. 500's Fastest-Growing Private U.S. Companies and one of Pittsburgh's Best Places to Work, Level delivers powerful and comprehensive online solutions including multi-channel digital marketing, search engine optimization, lead generation, website development, ROI reporting, and much more.  
 Level is an equal opportunity employer, a Military Friendly® partner, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  
 About the Position:   
 The  Media Analyst  will join a cross-functional team of performance marketers and will contribute to the strategic and tactical online media analysis, buying and planning for the agency's clients. Media performance is core to our company's data-driven philosophy, so you will play a crucial role in achieving our business goals and objectives. This role reports to our Media Manager.  
 
 We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work and will perform the work in the United States. We are not able to sponsor visas.   
 Your Impact:   
 
 Campaign building and management:  You'll be hands-on in managing paid search (SEM), paid social, and display digital marketing platforms. You’ll work in platforms including: Google Ads, Microsoft Advertising/Bing Ads, Meta Business Manager, LinkedIn Ads, Google Marketing Platform. You'll build, QA, and launch media campaigns across new and existing platforms.  
 Reporting and presentation:  You'll build and update dashboards, Excel, and PPT reports, and generate insights for weekly/monthly media reporting. Your reports will be critical in helping your team and your clients understand their media performance and make data-driven decisions.  
 Campaign performance optimization:  You'll own optimizing media performance based on agreed-upon KPIs. This will involve planning, proactive management and data hygiene, A/B testing, automation, and other strategies to ensure our clients' media investments deliver the best possible results.  
 Collaboration:  You'll collaborate within your cross-functional team including account managers, media producers, and data analysts, to ensure creative strategies align with clients' business goals and objectives.  
 
 
 Industry knowledge:  You'll keep up to date with the latest marketing industry and platform trends, features, and beta opportunities to better serve our clients. Your knowledge will help us stay ahead of the curve and deliver outstanding results for our clients.  
 Data management and analysis:  You'll be responsible for exporting and joining data from multiple ad platforms and analytics sources to create data models for analysis. You'll also analyze data and coordinate with media managers on trends, insights, and action recommendations.  
 
 Requirements 
 
 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail 
 Demonstrated ability to take ownership and deliver results 
 Understanding of data manipulation in Excel 
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team 
 Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Experience in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook 
 Familiarity with generative AI technologies, with a willingness to learn and apply these concepts in real-world scenarios. 
 
 Benefits 
 
 Remote work from anywhere in the US with an internet connection 
 Performance reviews every six months 
 401k plan with 3% employer contribution 
 11 annual paid holidays 
 15 PTO days + 1 additional day per year of service 
 Summer Fridays 
 Great medical benefits including vision and dental 
 20 Days of Paid Parental leave benefit after 1 year of full-time service 
 Career advancement opportunities 
 Employee appreciation programs

98d75ae95ddd3002.title: Performance Auditor/Analyst
98d75ae95ddd3002.desc:
ABOUT GIBSON CONSULTING GROUP 
 Gibson Consulting Group, Inc. is a privately held and nationally recognized education consulting and research firm headquartered in Austin, Texas. Founded in 1998, we have decades of experience working with school districts of all sizes, state education agencies, and other educational organizations in Texas and in 30 other states. Our mission is to better the lives of students by providing exemplary educational consulting and research services that make education systems more efficient and effective. We work to accomplish this mission by providing performance auditing, program evaluation (now including learning recovery), internal audit, process re-engineering, educational research, and data analysis services to our clients. 
 POSITION SUMMARY 
 Gibson is seeking to hire an auditor/analyst to support the firm’s growth in its education consulting practice. The ideal candidate will have two to four years of public accounting experience; possess strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills; and share our passion for improving public education systems. 
 This position will be responsible for assisting with a wide range of analyses, and the development client-specific, impactful recommendations. The types of analyses include cost savings, process improvement, maximizing the use of technology, and the improvement of management practices, internal controls, and compliance monitoring across administrative, operational, and program areas. Additionally, the candidate filling this position will be expected to actively contribute to Gibson’s knowledge growth through participation in internal meetings, presentations, and dissemination of relevant articles, research, and newsworthy events. 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
 ▪ Data Analysis / Data Analytics – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to perform analysis of financial and operational data using advanced spreadsheet functions and data analytics tools. The performance auditor will also be expected to analyze data, interpret results, and identify relationships to draw meaningful conclusions. 
 ▪ Process Analysis – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to develop and analyze processes to determine process inefficiencies, internal control weaknesses, and other issues that inform recommendations for improvement. 
 ▪ Client Interviews – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to assist in conducting interviews of senior leadership as well as staff involved in the various aspects of the day-to-day work. The performance auditor/analyst will also be expected to apply diagnostic skills in identifying and understanding potential problems. 
 ▪ Client and Project Team Communications – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to communicate effectively and professionally through written and oral communications, and possess strong listening skills. 
 ▪ Reports – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to assist in the development of well-organized and fully supported reports containing findings and recommendations in a clear and succinct manner that is free of technical jargon. 
 ▪ Client Presentations – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected assist in the development and delivery of highly professional and concise client presentations. 
 ▪ Business Development – the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to work with the proposal manager in developing project scopes, work plans, and budgets, as well as participating in conferences, proposal presentations, and other business development activities. 
 ▪ Continuous Improvement - the performance auditor/analyst will be expected to contribute to the Firm’s on-going efforts to continuously improve its consulting tools, templates and other resources. 
 REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
 ▪ Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting. 
 ▪ Minimum of two years of experience in public accounting with an international accounting firm. 
 ▪ Certified Public Accountant 
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 
 ▪ Strong data and process analysis skills. 
 ▪ Strong written and oral communication, interpersonal, organization, reasoning, and problem-solving skills. 
 ▪ Strong report writing and presentation skills. 
 ▪ Ability to work productively as a team member on a wide range of client projects.. 
 ▪ Capable of managing multiple responsibilities while ensuring prompt and accurate completion of required deliverables. 
 ▪ High proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. 
 EMPLOYMENT CONDITIONS, EXPECTATIONS, AND ASSURANCES 
 This exempt full-time position will require 40 hours of work per week, usually Monday through Friday. Flexible hours and work schedules will be considered after an individual establishes a track record of strong performance. This position requires that the incumbent sit or stand for extended periods of time while working on a computer. The ability to travel occasionally (15 percent to 20 percent) is required. 
 Candidates are not required to live in Austin, Texas as we are a fully remote firm. Gibson offers a competitive salary, opportunities for performance bonuses, generous vacation and personal leave, retirement benefits that include 401(k) matching, and employer contributions to health and life insurance. 
 All employment with Gibson is at-will. The salary range for this position will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience and expertise. 
 Gibson Consulting Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. To learn more about us, please visit www.gibsonconsult.com. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance
