  SDLC Automation such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins, CircleCI, etc 
  Creating and maintaining CI/CD pipelines 
  Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP) 
  Network programming; familiarity with HTTP, TCP/IP, and security groups 
  Observability tooling (e.g. Datadog, Splunk, Grafana, etc) 
  Building and maintaining Docker Images 
  Container Management Platforms (e.g. Kubernetes, ECS) 
  Scripting and automation tooling (e.g. bash, PowerShell) 
  Cloud Architecture and Their Best Practices 
 
 
   ThorTech Solutions is a New York-based software engineering and cloud consulting firm that has serviced clients for over 20 years. Our founders are engineers who thrive on tackling seemingly impossible problems. Our company culture reflects this passion for innovation, creativity, and constantly pushing ourselves to overcome challenges.
  
 
  Who we are: 
 
 
 
  ThorTech Solutions is founded by a team of software engineers with a passion for providing businesses with powerful solutions to simplify complex problems. We have clients across a variety of industries including healthcare, fintech, and major media. We are a small company that invests in the professional development of all employees towards training, certifications, and career growth.
  
 
 
  What we do: 
 
 
 
  We are a technology-first company specializing in near real-time highly available analytics platforms in the cloud. Some of the items in our tech stack include DynamoDb, Kinesis, Kafka, Elasticsearch, Containers (Kubernetes (K8s), Fargate), .NET core, SQL server, etc. We have clients across a variety of industries including healthcare, fintech, and major media.
  
 
 
  ThorTech Solutions is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

0aae8548bec9cabd.title: Principal DevOps Engineer
0aae8548bec9cabd.desc:
Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People 
  Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps create the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and improve outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at  www.medidata.com   and follow us  @medidata . 
  Our Team: 
  You will help our engineering team expand and maintain a Randomization and Trial Supplies Management application ("RTSM"), allowing clients to randomize trial participants and manage trial inventory. This solution has been helping clients with their clinical trials for over 10 years. 
  What we're looking for: 
  An engineer who is passionate about application deployment and monitoring, and who wants to stay current with new technologies and engineering concepts. Your primary responsibilities will include hands-on development of RTSM deployment pipelines, understanding pain points and creating and implementing solutions to address those pain points. We use Travis, GoCD, SumoLogic and AWS services like MSK, ECS and CloudWatch. Our goal is to achieve a fully automated, zero downtime blue/green deployment, and we need your help! 
  Design, build, test, document, deploy, monitor and maintain applications in a production environment. In addition to your primary responsibilities on RTSM, you will be providing leadership and guidance on DevOps and SRE practices across several products across the medidata clinical trials platform. We are looking for solutions that we can extend and standardize over our entire suite of products. 
  You will work with Agile team members, collaborating with developers, testers and with product managers to turn great ideas into detailed requirements. This is not a “throw it over the wall” environment: you will report to a manager who also manages application engineers. 
  Most team members are based in NYC out of our Soho office, but this position is also open to remote candidates. 
  Requirements (Education & Experience): 
 
 10+ years experience working with cloud deployments (here, you will use AWS). 
 Experience with the following a plus: 
     
 Observability, monitoring and alerting experience 
 SumoLogic (or some other log aggregation tool) dashboards 
 Error tracking, continuous profiling and user monitoring 
 
 
 
 
  not defined
  
  Diversity statement 
 
   As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.
  
  Equal opportunity 
 
   In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at 3DS are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. 3DS is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and above), disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. 3DS will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

bb0edccca1624ea2.title: CES - Senior DevOps Engineer (Remote, US)
bb0edccca1624ea2.desc:
Sr DevOps Engineer, Customer Experience Solutions Group - Remote US
   
 
 
 
 
  EverCommerce [Nasdaq: EVCM] is a leading service commerce platform, providing vertically tailored, integrated SaaS solutions that help more than 600,000 global service-based businesses accelerate growth, streamline operations, and increase retention. Our modern digital and mobile applications create predictable, informed, and convenient experiences between customers and their service professionals. Specializing in Home & Field Services, Health Services, and Fitness & Wellness industries, EverCommerce solutions include end-to-end business management software, embedded payment acceptance, marketing technology, and customer engagement applications.
   
 
 
 
 
  We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our team. You can learn more about our Company, Culture and Values here: https://careers.evercommerce.com/us/en
   
 
 
 
 
  We are looking for a Sr. DevOps Engineer to focus on our Customer Experience Solutions Group (Listen360, CustomerLobby, Guild Quality, and PulseM). CES is focused on simplifying and empowering the lives of business owners whose services support us every day. Fostering the relationship between our clients and their customers requires their sacred trust. We strive to earn that trust every day by providing them with the tools they need to continuously assess, promote and grow their business.
   
 
 
 
 
 
  Responsibilities
    
 
 
 
 
 
       Help ensure our infrastructure and applications are built with security, performance, and scalability in mind.
      
 
 
       Design, develop and implement automated build & deployment processes, CI/CD pipelines.
      
 
 
       Implement and maintain changes to infrastructure using Terraform and similar tools.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
       Work with engineering teams to develop and implement tools that monitor infrastructure and application performance.
      
 
 
       Work with engineering teams to detect, debug and correct operational issues.
      
 
 
       Research new technologies and strategies
      
 
 
       Write and maintain documentation related to the infrastructure and processes.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Skills and Experience Needed for Success in this Role
    
 
  BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject 
  5+ years of full stack development experience 
  8+ years of experience using and developing with DevOps tools in AWS and Azure 
  8+ years of experience with AWS Console and CLI for following technologies and similar
      
  IAM 
  EC2 
  S3 
  EKS/ECS 
  VPC 
  RDS 
  ES 
  CloudFront 
  Redis 
  Route53 
 
  Experience with Linux server administration 
  Experience with PostgreSQL, MySQL or other relational databases 
  Experience with MS Azure (Citus/Cosmos database) 
  Experience maintaining and setting up cloud infrastructure with Terraform 
  Experience with deployment automation tools such as AWS CodeDeploy, Jenkins, Github Actions or other tools 
  Experience with Docker and Kubernetes 
  Experience writing BASH/Shell scripting 
  Strong written and verbal communications skills 
  Strong knowledge of best practice for cloud computing and security 
 
 
 
 
 
     Where:
    
 
     The EverCommerce team is distributed globally, with teams in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Jordan, New Zealand, and Australia. With a widely distributed team, we are used to working remotely across different time zones. This role can be based anywhere in the United States or Canada – if you’re close to one of our offices, we can set you up in-office or you can work 100% remotely. Please note that you must be eligible to work without sponsorship to qualify for this position, and this role may require travel to our Corporate Headquarters in Denver, Colorado, or to other office locations around North America.
    
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Benefits and Perks:
    
 
 
 
 
 
       Flexibility to work where/how you want within your country of employment – in-office, remote, or hybrid
      
 
 
       Continued investment in your professional development through Udemy
      
 
 
       Robust health and wellness benefits, including an annual wellness stipend
      
 
 
       401k with up to a 4% match and immediate vesting
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
       Flexible and generous (FTO) time-off
      
 
 
       Employee Stock Purchase Program
      
 
 
       Student Loan Repayment Program
      
 
 
 
 
 
  Compensation: The target base compensation for this position is up to $130k/year. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including location, local market variances, and candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above.
    
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
          EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

9e9c2dbfdf0a3cf5.title: Sr. Manager, DevOps Team Lead, Identity Assurance
9e9c2dbfdf0a3cf5.desc:
Job Description
   About This Role  Biogen is seeking a proven DevOps Team Lead with expertise in IAM, specifically in systems used for directory services, authentication and authorization. At Biogen, we call this Identity Assurance. As DevOps Team Lead, you will be responsible for pulling together the appropriate analysts, developers, configurators, testing, documentation, and other resources necessary to deliver a defined sprint (or set of sprints) as per an approved project or in support of operations. You will need to be a technical expert and also lead a team of specialized technologists, providing the insights and engineering to protect Biogen from major cybersecurity incidents. This senior leader will report directly to the Head of Access Automation within our Cybersecurity organization and is the functional manager of 2 employees and a team of ~3-5 MSP resources. Access Automation is a cornerstone of Biogen’s application security and GXP/Quality compliance programs. This role will ultimately impact every key application user in the corporation and is a critical customer-facing leadership position within our Cybersecurity organization. 
  What You’ll Do  
 
 Assess and understand Biogen's Authentication & Authorization requirements and target architecture, identify risks/gaps to current state, design and implement secure patterns for access within the context of Biogen's Access Management architecture to reduce risk/close the gaps 
  Serves as a security expert in AD, Okta, RBAC, and PAM platform configuration/development, and on-going operations complying with enterprise and security policies, industry regulations, and best practices 
  Develop the business, information, and technical artifacts that constitute Biogen's Identity security architecture and solutions 
  Communicate security risks and solutions to business partners and IT staff 
  Lead the hands-on design, development and integration of authentication and authorization solutions approved for development. (From small enhancements to large-scale projects.) DevOps tools and technologies for deployment, monitoring, and operations of systems and applications 
  Ensure that cybersecurity solutions are of high quality and meet or exceed stakeholder expectations 
  Coordinate the efforts of development teams with that of operations teams to streamline the development process and build and evolve an automated, secure, and scalable continuous delivery pipeline with high-quality releases to end users 
  Drive adoption and improvement of the Agile / DevOps approach to system development at Biogen 
  Increase the adoption of continuous build, inspection, testing, automated deployment and performance monitoring approaches to ensure maximum uptime and optimal performance in the Production environment 
  Ensure that cybersecurity solutions are delivered in compliance with organizational policies, standards, and regulatory requirements. Align with business governance bodies and procedures to ensure appropriate input across relevant stakeholder functions 
  Ensure that all IT solutions are delivered within the allocated budget targets 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications
   Who You Are  You are resourceful and driven to deliver a superior product and customer experience. You have demonstrable experience building, engineering and troubleshooting complex processes, and conducting root cause analysis. You are able to lead engineers, adapt to different stakeholders’ technical abilities and communicate effectively with business and IT professionals. 
 
  Required Skills 
 
 
 10+ years of IT experience, including 5-8 years of hands on experience with authentication and authorization technologies 
 3-5 years experience managing / leading teams 
 Deep subject matter expertise in Access Management platforms (MS Active Directory, Azure, Okta) and PAM platforms (CyberArk). Working knowledge of best practices for integration methodologies with these platforms for various use cases (ie. Human, IT Resources, Applications, Software Tools, Developer tools, Endpoints, IOT, and Industrial Controls/Equipment) 
 Stakeholder Relationship Management 
 Program/Project Management 
 Agile Methodology 
 Requirements Definition and Management 
 Release and Deployment 
 Change Control 
 Systems Development Management 
 Integration and System Testing 
 Test Planning and Execution 
 User Acceptance Testing (UAT) 
 Solution Planning 
 Demand Management 
 
 
 
  Education:  Undergraduate degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience required
   
 
 Preferred Skills 
 
 
 MSP Service Delivery Management 
 MSP Service Delivery Operations - Application Development and Delivery 
 Software Configuration 
 Contract Management 
 SLA Management 
 Vendor Management 
 
 
  Additional Information
   The base compensation range for this role is $113,700 to $183,300. Base salary is determined by a combination of factors including, but not limited to, job related years of relevant experience, internal equity, and location of the job. Additionally, this role is eligible for participation in Biogen’s LTI grants and other incentive programs. Biogen offers a full range of benefits that include medical, dental, life, long and short-term disability insurances, vacation, end-of-year shutdown, and 401K participation and matching contributions. 
  “Diversity is key for the survival of our ecosystem. I believe it is the single most important factor for a balanced flourishing environment where everyone thrives.” 
  Guy Hadari – Chief Information Officer- Biogen 
 
  Why Biogen? 
  Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive. 
  At Biogen, we are committed to building on our culture of inclusion and belonging that reflects the communities where we operate and the patients we serve. We know that diverse backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives make us a stronger and more innovative company, and we are focused on building teams where every employee feels empowered and inspired. Read on to learn more about our DE&I efforts. 
  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, race, color, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, religion, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. Biogen is an E-Verify Employer in the United States.

0328a3f17110fada.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
0328a3f17110fada.desc:
About Figure 
  Figure is transforming the trillion dollar financial services industry using blockchain technology. 
  In five short years, Figure has unveiled a series of fintech firsts using the Provenance blockchain for loan origination, equity management, private fund services, banking and payments sectors - bringing speed, efficiency and savings to both consumers and institutions. Today, Figure is one of less than a thousand companies considered a unicorn, globally. 
  Our mission requires us to have a creative, team-oriented, and supportive environment where everyone can do their absolute best. The team is composed of driven, innovative, collaborative, and curious people who love architecting ground-breaking technologies. We value individuals who bring an entrepreneurial mindset to every task and will embrace our culture of innovation. 
  Every day at Figure is a journey in continuous learning yet a daily focus on getting work done that makes a difference. Join a team of proven leaders who have already created billions of dollars in value in the FinTech space! 
  Forbes America's Best Startup Employers 
  Forbes Top 50 Blockchain Companies 
  Figure Series D Announcement 
  About the Role 
  Figure is excited to be growing our business and creating new teams. We are looking for curious, innovative and collaborative team members. Engineering is at the heart of the action, building out our blockchain protocol and direct to consumer products that will transform the financial services industry. Everything is from scratch development and every engineer has a big impact on the team and the growth of the company. 
  A successful member of the Figure engineering team embraces formidable goals and excels at delivering solutions in a responsive and communicative fashion. We use Kubernetes making security, scalability, and change management of the utmost importance. To deliver solutions, infrastructure as code is a necessity, and Terraform provides IaC for our foundation of instances, databases, and networks. 
  What You'll Do 
 
 Adhere to iterative principles driving production of innovative tech solutions in a team environment 
 Originate, champion and execute on new ideas for projects 
 Collaborate with project leads and and other software engineers across multiple teams and projects 
 
 What We Look For 
 
 Bachelor's degree with a Computer Science major preferred 
 Tech industry experience required 
 Proficiency managing cloud data centers and provisioning cloud data stores and maintenance of production data at scale 
 5+ years of managing Kubernetes clusters 
 Experience with Helm or Kustomize 
 Familiarity with the following: Redis, Postgres, GitHub Actions Kong/Nginx, JWT 
 Experience writing applications in Golang 
 Familiarity with Terraform or another equivalent IaC framework. 
 Experience in a fast paced development environment 
 Ability to drive a project from concept to release and implement infrastructure from the ground up with infrastructure as code. 
 Previous experience managing infrastructure within an enterprise data center or cloud based data center 
 Proficiency in securing data using cryptographic best practices and securing enterprise networks 
 Ability to thrive in a start up environment with maximum autonomy 
 
 Benefits To You 
 
 Competitive salary based on experience and skills 
 Firm-wide performance based bonus 
 Competitive stock options package as an early member of the team 
 A flexible paid time off and vacation policy 
 Comprehensive health, vision, dental insurance 
 Company FSA, 401k, commuter benefits 
 And much more to come! 
 
 For CO, NY, CA and WA residents, the salary range is  $119,680 - 149,600  with a 25% Bonus and Equity. Actual compensation may vary based on individual candidate experience and location. 
  Depending on your residential location certain laws might regulate the way Figure manages applicant data. California Residents, please review our California Employee and Prospective Employee Privacy Notice for further information. By submitting your application, you are agreeing and acknowledging that you have read and understand the above notice. 
  Figure will NOT sponsor work visas for this position. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

35a20ec4d016a5f7.title: DevOps Engineer
35a20ec4d016a5f7.desc:
About Us: 
 
 
 
  Avive Solutions, Inc. (https://avive.life) is a VC-backed healthcare technology company that has developed an FDA approved, next-generation Automated External Defibrillator (AED) and response system in an effort to – 
   literally  – save lives. Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA) is a leading cause of death in the United States, and we are on a mission to change that! We are a dynamic team that builds elegant, creative solutions to solve complex problems. Ultimately, our mission is for all cardiac arrest victims to have rapid access to life-saving defibrillation.
   
 
 
 
 
  Avive is taking a fresh approach to addressing this decades-old problem by providing an advanced AED technology, coupled with a first-of-its-kind software platform solution to enable a quicker and more streamlined response to cardiac arrest emergencies. We believe that this unique combination of deploying advanced – yet still accessible – hardware, and novel software, has the potential to revolutionize out-of-hospital cardiac arrest response and massively impact SCA survival rates.
  
 
 
  Check out this short video that shows a glimpse of how our team is working to re-think cardiac arrest response and save lives! https://youtu.be/0AS_pyg4RB8
  
 
 
 
  About the Role: 
 
 
 
  The DevOps Engineer within Avive’s R&D organization will help create an optimized cloud-based infrastructure from early design stages through production releases, maintenance, and expansions. This position plays an active role in providing public facing cloud-based product software, and enables Avive’s platform for revolutionizing cardiac arrest response.
  
 What you'll do: 
 
  Designs and orchestrates provisioning, installation, dynamic configuration, monitoring and maintenance of services in the cloud environment. 
  Automates CI/CD & IaC: processes, workflows, configurations (AWS CLI, AWS SDK for Python Boto3, Bash and Python scripting, Comfortable with Linux & command line) 
  Continuously streamlines and optimizes Cloud footprint including configuration management optimizations. 
  Works collaboratively with in-house software engineers, contractors, and external services. Periodically collaborates with teammates across time zones. 
  Implements and automates monitoring systems to detect and escalate service / security issues and diagnose/fix service performance to achieve high levels of system availability, performance, and security. 
  Troubleshoots and resolves incidents, works to ensure that service level commitments are achieved. 
  Embraces new ideas and technologies that produce outstanding results for our customers and efficiency for Avive. 
  Shares on-call duties with other team members and contractors. 
  Estimates work and provides deliverables within agreed upon timeframes. 
 
  Who you are: 
 
  Minimum of five (5) years of related DevOps experience with AWS using CloudFormation as well as PKI 
  Minimum of one (1) year using Docker CI/CD & IaC with AWS ECR & ECS (or equivalent with Kubernetes) 
  Experienced in AWS monitoring tools and related dashboards 
  Knowledgeable in AWS Cloudformation, JSON &YAML, properly scoped & nested stacks 
  Worked with AWS cost management 
  Familiarity with AWS IAM Identity Center, IAM role & policies 
  Experience with Mobile CI/CD (MS App Center/BitRise/etc.) 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills including technical writing 
  AWS Cloud formation, JSON &YAML, properly scoped & nested stacks (or equivalent with Terraform and Ansible) 
 
 
  Bonus points for: 
 
  Agile with Scrum 
  Infrastructure of Code tooling, Terraform and Ansible 
  Microservices architecture, container orchestration (Kubernetes), High-Availability 
  JavaScript, Python and Python based frameworks such as Django 
  Azure, GCP, or other similar cloud offering in addition to AWS 
  MySQL databases such as MySQL, NoSQL and Document oriented databases including MongoDB or similar. 
  Previous work with a Medical Device company or other entity regulated by the FDA, FAA, etc. 
 
 
  Equal Employment Opportunity 
 
 
   It is the policy of the company to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the company will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
  
 
 
  NOTE: This Job Description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties or functions to be performed by the incumbent. Personnel are required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties/functions requested by their supervisor.
  
 
 
  Anticipated salary range: $120,000 - $165,000 (based on experience and location)

  About the Role 
  Figure is excited to be growing our business and creating new teams. We are looking for curious, innovative and collaborative team members. Engineering is at the heart of the action, building out our blockchain protocol and direct to consumer products that will transform the financial services industry.  What We Look For 
 
 Bachelor's degree with a Computer Science major preferred 
 Tech industry experience required 
 Proficiency managing cloud data centers and provisioning cloud data stores and maintenance of production data at scale 
 5+ years of managing Kubernetes clusters 
 Experience with Helm or Kustomize 
 Familiarity with the following: Redis, Postgres, GitHub Actions Kong/Nginx, JWT 
 Experience writing applications in Golang 
 Familiarity with Terraform or another equivalent IaC framework. 
 Experience in a fast paced development environment 
 Ability to drive a project from concept to release and implement infrastructure from the ground up with infrastructure as code. 
 Previous experience managing infrastructure within an enterprise data center or cloud based data center 
 Proficiency in securing data using cryptographic best practices and securing enterprise networks 
 Ability to thrive in a start up environment with maximum autonomy 
 
 Benefits To You 
 
 Competitive salary based on experience and skills 
 Firm-wide performance based bonus

 Company FSA, 401k, commuter benefits
